results.title: Village on the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: State Historian, Dr. Bernard Barrett talks about early Melbourne, the first landing parties in the Melbourne areas and the events leading up to its establishment on the banks of the Yarra.

results.title: STD's . . . Not just long distance phone calls
results.creator_credit: Wendy Thompson, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: An entertaining look at the ways in which sexually transmitted diseases are transmitted and how they can (mostly) be cured. Looks at what happens at an STD clinic and encourages the use of condoms to prevent STDs.

results.title: OTC memories
results.brief_description: A compilation on the OTC television commercial featuring the theme “Memories” It includes Greece, Netherlands, Germany, Italy and many other countries.No other credits available.

results.title: Last resort
results.creator_credit: Robert Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: An insight into the role and function of the Victorian Ombudsman through the dramatization of actual cases investigated by the Office. Includes an interview with the Ombudsman.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Bob Scarfe, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

video_links.name: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years

results.brief_description: An education officer from the Museum of Victoria looks at a number of “labour saving appliances” used in the home over the last one hundred and fifty years and looks at the development of laundry and kitchen appliances.

results.title: Westgarthtown: the German settlement at Thomastown
results.creator_credit: Stuart Miller and Multicultural Materials Production Project
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the first German settlers to the Port Phillip District in 1850 who settled mainly at Westgarthtown which became Thomastown. These first settlers did not speak any English and brought the Lutheran religion to Australia. This German community worked hard to retain the values, beliefs and cultural background of Germany.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Miller and Multicultural Materials Production Project

results.title: Accounting
results.brief_description: This program looks at what attracts people to Accounting as a career. It also looks at how computerization has changed the face of accounting. Industry and commerce, Government agencies, public accounting, education (research and development) are all possible career areas which require accountants.

results.title: Looking at Puffing Billy
results.brief_description: An enthusiasts video production about the Puffing Billy railway beginning with a brief history of the line, its relatively recent retoration, and the work of the Puffing Bily Preservation Society. We are taken on a detailed trip along the line from Belgrave to Emerald Lake.

results.title: Women working in the media
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Pat Walter, a video camera operator, Julie Copeland, a radio broadcaster and producer, and Lina Caneva, a TV and radio journalist, discuss their experiences as women working in the male-dominated TV and radio industry.

results.title: Victoria's first settlers
results.creator_credit: Lili Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The state historian of Victoria Mr Bernard Barrett talks to Trevor Lunn about Victoria’s Aboriginal past, the first British visitors, sealers and whalers and the settlements at Portland and Melbourne.
